text.text: Backup is only available if secondary ROM
does not share the kernel with internal ROM.
A ROM with that name already exists!
{@zip_back_cancel=Press back to cancel adding this zip.}
is not implemented in this version of MultiROM
The no-kexec workaround is not an officially supported
method. Therefore it is up to the device maintainer to
decide whether to allow this functionality, as it may not
function on all devices, and needs proper testing.
The preferred method (and only one in this case) is
to use a kexec-hardboot enabled kernel In Primary ROM

listitem.name: ... but also ask for confirmation before booting
Ask whether to kexec or use no-kexec on booting

text.text: Press and hold volume up or down
during boot to enter the MultiROM menu.
This very likely means your boot.img is now
unstable, and the ROM in question may not boot.
You should consider reflashing the ROM or at
least its boot.img or a compatible "kernel".
On encrypted devices, this may also mean that on
"second boot" multirom may not be able to decrypt your
data partition, in which case you should reboot to TWRP
and reflash a proper boot.img for the ROM in question.

checkbox.text: Enable System Partition Mode (e.g. for Magisk)

text.text: Set up the size of disk images.
If a FAT32 partition is used,
size of the image is limited to 4095MB.

button.text: Copy secondary ROM to primary slot
Copy secondary ROM to primary slot

listbox.text: Select secondary ROM to swap with:

text.text: This action will create a copy of your current
This action will remove your current
primary ROM and then add it to secondary ROMs.
You can choose name of this new ROM below.
Select secondary ROM to swap primary with.
Select secondary ROM to copy into primary slot.
